page.title: 07Changes in Stallingborough
page.content: Stallingborough used to have a mill. It ground corn for flour for the villagers but now it is a house.The station has also changed.Steam trains would take people or goods to market. Diesels have replaced these trains because they are faster and cleaner if not so frequent.Springs provided the villager's water supply but new factories have taken all the water and the springs have dried up.These factories created work for people. There used to be work on the farms round Sallingborough.Mechanization is the force behind all these changes.The evidence for this is the village traffic.Over the years the roads have got busier people owning their own cars.There are also lorries travelling to and from the factories. This has spoilt the quiet rural atmosphere of the village.
